channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: Adaptation of uncertainty-penalized Bayesian information criterion for parametric partial differential equation discovery
item.description: Data-driven discovery of partial differential equations (PDEs) has emerged as a promising approach for deriving governing physics when domain knowledge about observed data is limited.

item.title: Maximally Permissive Reward Machines
item.description: We prove that learning using such "maximally permissive" reward machines results in higher rewards than learning using RMs based on a single plan.

item.title: HAIR: Hypernetworks-based All-in-One Image Restoration
item.description: To be more specific, the Classifier is a simple image classification network which is used to generate a Global Information Vector (GIV) that contains the degradation information of the input image; And the HSNs can be seen as a simple Fully-connected Neural Network that receive the GIV and output parameters for the corresponding modules.

item.title: Snuffy: Efficient Whole Slide Image Classifier
item.description: Our sparsity pattern is tailored for pathology and is theoretically proven to be a universal approximator with the tightest probabilistic sharp bound on the number of layers for sparse transformers, to date.

item.title: Normalized AOPC: Fixing Misleading Faithfulness Metrics for Feature Attribution Explainability
item.description: Deep neural network predictions are notoriously difficult to interpret.

item.title: IIU: Independent Inference Units for Knowledge-based Visual Question Answering
item.description: In this paper, we propose Independent Inference Units (IIU) for fine-grained multi-modal reasoning to decompose intra-modal information by the functionally independent units.

item.title: Unsupervised Part Discovery via Dual Representation Alignment
item.description: Object parts serve as crucial intermediate representations in various downstream tasks, but part-level representation learning still has not received as much attention as other vision tasks.

item.title: InVAErt networks for amortized inference and identifiability analysis of lumped parameter hemodynamic models
item.description: Estimation of cardiovascular model parameters from electronic health records (EHR) poses a significant challenge primarily due to lack of identifiability.

item.title: Federated Fairness Analytics: Quantifying Fairness in Federated Learning
item.description: Federated Learning (FL) is a privacy-enhancing technology for distributed ML.

item.title: Rethinking Medical Anomaly Detection in Brain MRI: An Image Quality Assessment Perspective
item.description: Reconstruction-based methods, particularly those leveraging autoencoders, have been widely adopted to perform anomaly detection in brain MRI.

item.title: FuseChat: Knowledge Fusion of Chat Models
item.description: In this work, we propose a new framework for the knowledge fusion of chat LLMs through two main stages, resulting in FuseChat.

item.title: ArabLegalEval: A Multitask Benchmark for Assessing Arabic Legal Knowledge in Large Language Models
item.description: However, the evaluation of LLMs' legal knowledge, particularly in non-English languages such as Arabic, remains under-explored.

item.title: Improved transferability of self-supervised learning models through batch normalization finetuning
item.description: At a cost of extra training of only 0. 16% model parameters, in case of ResNet-50, we acquire a proxy task that (i) has a stronger correlation with end-to-end finetuned performance, (ii) improves the linear probing performance in the many- and few-shot learning regimes and (iii) in some cases, outperforms both linear probing and end-to-end finetuning, reaching the state-of-the-art performance on a pathology dataset.

item.title: Data-driven identification of latent port-Hamiltonian systems
item.description: In this space, a linear pH system, that satisfies the pH properties per construction, is parameterized by the weights of a neural network.

item.title: Explaining an Agent's Future Beliefs through Temporally Decomposing Future Reward Estimators
item.description: Future reward estimation is a core component of reinforcement learning agents; i. e., Q-value and state-value functions, predicting an agent's sum of future rewards.

item.title: SLCA++: Unleash the Power of Sequential Fine-tuning for Continual Learning with Pre-training
item.description: Considering that the overly fast representation learning and the biased classification layer constitute this particular problem, we introduce the advanced Slow Learner with Classifier Alignment (SLCA++) framework to unleash the power of Seq FT, serving as a strong baseline approach for CLPT.

item.title: Impact of Comprehensive Data Preprocessing on Predictive Modelling of COVID-19 Mortality
item.description: This study evaluates the impact of a custom data preprocessing pipeline on ten machine learning models predicting COVID-19 mortality using data from Our World in Data (OWID).

item.title: Causal Discovery from Time-Series Data with Short-Term Invariance-Based Convolutional Neural Networks
item.description: Causal discovery from time-series data aims to capture both intra-slice (contemporaneous) and inter-slice (time-lagged) causality between variables within the temporal chain, which is crucial for various scientific disciplines.

item.title: CatalogBank: A Structured and Interoperable Catalog Dataset with a Semi-Automatic Annotation Tool (DocumentLabeler) for Engineering System Design
item.description: In the realm of document engineering and Natural Language Processing (NLP), the integration of digitally born catalogs into product design processes presents a novel avenue for enhancing information extraction and interoperability.

item.title: Assessing Language Models' Worldview for Fiction Generation
item.description: We highlight the limitations of current LLMs in fiction writing and advocate for future research to test and create story worlds for LLMs to reside in.

item.title: GOReloc: Graph-based Object-Level Relocalization for Visual SLAM
item.description: It determines the pose of a camera sensor by robustly associating the object detections in the current frame with 3D objects in a lightweight object-level map.

item.title: ColorMamba: Towards High-quality NIR-to-RGB Spectral Translation with Mamba
item.description: To explore global long-range dependencies and local context for efficient spectral translation, we introduce learnable padding tokens to enhance the distinction of image boundaries and prevent potential confusion within the sequence model.

item.title: Accelerating High-Fidelity Waveform Generation via Adversarial Flow Matching Optimization
item.description: This paper introduces PeriodWave-Turbo, a high-fidelity and high-efficient waveform generation model via adversarial flow matching optimization.

item.title: Persistence Image from 3D Medical Image: Superpixel and Optimized Gaussian Coefficient
item.description: Topological data analysis (TDA) uncovers crucial properties of objects in medical imaging.

item.title: DIVE: Towards Descriptive and Diverse Visual Commonsense Generation
item.description: Towards human-level visual understanding, visual commonsense generation has been introduced to generate commonsense inferences beyond images.

item.title: Treat Stillness with Movement: Remote Sensing Change Detection via Coarse-grained Temporal Foregrounds Mining
item.description: We also introduce a motion augmented strategy that leverages motion cues as an additional output to aggregate with the spatial features for improved results.

item.title: Comparative Evaluation of 3D Reconstruction Methods for Object Pose Estimation
item.description: We aim to answer this question by proposing a novel benchmark for measuring the impact of 3D reconstruction quality on pose estimation accuracy.

item.title: A Multi-task Adversarial Attack Against Face Authentication
item.description: In this paper, we propose a multi-task adversarial attack algorithm called MTADV that are adaptable for multiple users or systems.

item.title: MambaMIM: Pre-training Mamba with State Space Token-interpolation
item.description: To address this challenge, we introduce a generative self-supervised learning method for Mamba (MambaMIM) based on Selective Structure State Space Sequence Token-interpolation (S6T), a general-purpose pre-training method for arbitrary Mamba architectures.

item.title: Monte Carlo Path Tracing and Statistical Event Detection for Event Camera Simulation
item.description: This paper presents a novel event camera simulation system fully based on physically based Monte Carlo path tracing with adaptive path sampling.

item.title: Computer Vision Model Compression Techniques for Embedded Systems: A Survey
item.description: Deep neural networks have consistently represented the state of the art in most computer vision problems.

item.title: Category-Prompt Refined Feature Learning for Long-Tailed Multi-Label Image Classification
item.description: Real-world data consistently exhibits a long-tailed distribution, often spanning multiple categories.

item.title: Multimodal Causal Reasoning Benchmark: Challenging Vision Large Language Models to Infer Causal Links Between Siamese Images
item.description: However, will these causalities remain straightforward for Vision Large Language Models (VLLMs) when only visual hints are provided?

item.title: Quantum-inspired Interpretable Deep Learning Architecture for Text Sentiment Analysis
item.description: Text has become the predominant form of communication on social media, embedding a wealth of emotional nuances.

item.title: Enhancing Model Interpretability with Local Attribution over Global Exploration
item.description: The LA algorithm comprises both targeted and untargeted exploration phases, which are designed to effectively generate intermediate states for attribution that thoroughly encompass the local space.

item.title: Improved 3D Whole Heart Geometry from Sparse CMR Slices
item.description: In this study, we explore the combination of Slice Shifting Algorithm (SSA), Spatial Transformer Network (STN), and Label Transformer Network (LTN) to: 1) correct respiratory motion between segmented slices, and 2) transform sparse segmentation data into dense segmentation.

item.title: Towards Real-time Video Compressive Sensing on Mobile Devices
item.description: The fast evolving mobile devices and existing high-performance video SCI reconstruction algorithms motivate us to develop mobile reconstruction methods for real-world applications.

item.title: BAPLe: Backdoor Attacks on Medical Foundational Models using Prompt Learning
item.description: Inspired by the latest developments in learnable prompts, this work introduces a method to embed a backdoor into the medical foundation model during the prompt learning phase.

item.title: Sum-Product-Set Networks
item.description: Daily internet communication relies heavily on tree-structured graphs, embodied by popular data formats such as XML and JSON.

item.title: BadMerging: Backdoor Attacks Against Model Merging
item.description: Considering that a merged model may incorporate tasks from different domains, BadMerging can jointly compromise the tasks provided by the adversary (on-task attack) and other contributors (off-task attack) and solve the corresponding unique challenges with novel attack designs.

item.title: Robust Semi-supervised Multimodal Medical Image Segmentation via Cross Modality Collaboration
item.description: With a channel-wise semantic consistency loss, our framework ensures alignment of modality-independent information from a feature-wise perspective across modalities, thereby fortifying it against misalignments in multimodal scenarios.

item.title: Knowledge Distillation with Refined Logits
item.description: Recent research on knowledge distillation has increasingly focused on logit distillation because of its simplicity, effectiveness, and versatility in model compression.

item.title: Pattern-Matching Dynamic Memory Network for Dual-Mode Traffic Prediction
item.description: PM-DMNet employs a novel dynamic memory network to capture traffic pattern features with only O(N) complexity, significantly reducing computational overhead while achieving excellent performance.

item.title: Wasserstein Gradient Flows of MMD Functionals with Distance Kernel and Cauchy Problems on Quantile Functions
item.description:
We give a comprehensive description of Wasserstein gradient flows of maximum mean discrepancy (MMD) functionals $\mathcal F_
u := 	ext{MMD}_K^2(\cdot, 
u)$ towards given target measures $
u$ on the real line, where we focus on the negative distance kernel $K(x, y) := -|x-y|$.

item.title: A Spitting Image: Modular Superpixel Tokenization in Vision Transformers
item.description: Vision Transformer (ViT) architectures traditionally employ a grid-based approach to tokenization independent of the semantic content of an image.

item.title: Knowledge in Superposition: Unveiling the Failures of Lifelong Knowledge Editing for Large Language Models
item.description: Moreover, this is the first study to investigate knowledge editing from the perspective of superposition and provides a comprehensive observation of superposition across numerous real-world language models.

item.title: SigmaRL: A Sample-Efficient and Generalizable Multi-Agent Reinforcement Learning Framework for Motion Planning
item.description: Most RL agents exhibit a limited capacity to generalize, often focusing narrowly on specific scenarios, and are usually evaluated in similar or even the same scenarios seen during training.

item.title: Lesion-aware network for diabetic retinopathy diagnosis
item.description: To this end, we propose a CNN-based DR diagnosis network with attention mechanism involved, termed lesion-aware network, to better capture lesion information from imbalanced data.

item.title: Whitening Consistently Improves Self-Supervised Learning
item.description: In this study, we propose incorporating ZCA whitening as the final layer of the encoder in self-supervised learning to enhance the quality of learned features by normalizing and decorrelating them.

item.title: GRFormer: Grouped Residual Self-Attention for Lightweight Single Image Super-Resolution
item.description: The code is available at \url{https://github. com/sisrformer/GRFormer}.
